title: Should the word 'while' be used to mean 'although' in formal writing? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. If you mean “although”, then “although” is the right word to use. Especially in formal writing. I presume your formal writing has a purpose? Does that purpose include wanting people to have a clear understanding of your meaning? Then use the word that means what you mean in preference to a word that might be ambiguous.

While I’m generally in favour of using erudite terms - in the appropriate context - I don’t think that this specific use of “while” is necessary. it’s an option, but it’s starting to sound a little dusty.
